New Records: Cristian Javier allowed three runs and four hits in the first inning, a poor start for the Astros.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager launched a 440-foot home run into the second deck in right field for a home run.
Evan Carter walked and stole second base before scoring on a single by Adolis García.
García stole second and Mitch Garver followed with a pop-fly single to left-center field.
The ball bounced off the shoulder of diving left fielder Michael Brantley, and García scored to make it 3-0.
J.P. France surrendered a two-run double to Evan Carter and a two-run single by García.
Bregman’s solo homer in the bottom of the third closed the gap to 4-2.
Pre-Game Insights: Houston manager Dusty Baker said the team has been spoiled with winning and winning, but they have nothing to be ashamed of.
Post-Match Reflections: Baker said they're down, but they're not out, and every team in baseball would trade to have had the last four years that they've had.
Alex Bregman was disappointed that Houston’s quest for a third straight trip to the World Series came up short.
Catcher Martín Maldonado addressed Cristian Javier’s struggles, saying his command wasn't great and his off-speed pitches weren't sharp.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros are the only big league team to lose four home games in a seven-game postseason series.
No team with a losing record at home has ever reached the World Series.
Houston closed to 4-2 on Bregman’s solo homer in the bottom of the third.
Others: Big league teams are 3-9 in postseason history when their starting pitcher lasts less than an inning in a winner-take-all game.
